items.label: cor-baoab-validity
items.title: BAOAB Discretization Validity
items.content:
1115: :label: cor-baoab-validity
1116: 
1117: **Hypotheses:** Consider the adaptive Langevin SDE with:
1118: 1. Fitness potential $V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho] \in C^3(\mathcal{X})$ with bounded derivatives (Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-c3-regularity`)
1119: 2. Friction coefficient $\gamma > 0$
1120: 3. Temperature $T > 0$ (or equivalently, noise scale $\sigma > 0$)
1121: 4. Time step $\Delta t$ satisfying the stability criterion:
1122: 
1123: $$
1124: \Delta t \le \Delta t_{\max}(\rho, \gamma) := \min\left( \frac{1}{2\gamma}, \frac{\rho^{3/2}}{K_{V,3}(\rho)^{1/2}} \right)
1125: $$
1126: 
1127: **Conclusion:** The BAOAB splitting integrator applied to the adaptive SDE has:
1128: 
1129: 1. **Weak error bound:** $\mathbb{E}[f(X_n)] - \mathbb{E}_{\pi_{\text{QSD}}}[f] = O(\Delta t^2)$ for smooth test functions $f$
1130: 2. **Stability:** The discrete-time Markov chain remains ergodic with invariant measure approximating $\pi_{\text{QSD}}$
1131: 3. **Foster-Lyapunov preservation:** The drift inequality $\mathcal{L}V \le -\lambda V + b$ for the continuous SDE translates to the discrete chain with error $O(\Delta t^3)$

items.label: cor-lyapunov-c3
items.title: $C^3$ Regularity of Total Lyapunov Function
items.content:
1153: :label: cor-lyapunov-c3
1154: 
1155: The total Lyapunov function $V_{\text{total}}(S) = V_{\text{pos}}(S) + \lambda_v V_{\text{vel}}(S)$ used in the Foster-Lyapunov analysis satisfies $V_{\text{total}} \in C^3$ with N-uniform bounds:
1156: 
1157: $$
1158: \|\nabla^3 V_{\text{total}}\| \le K_{\text{total},3} < \infty
1159: $$
1160: 
1161: where $K_{\text{total},3}$ depends on the third-derivative bounds of the confining potential $U(x)$, the fitness potential $V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho]$, and the quadratic velocity term.

items.label: cor-smooth-perturbation
items.title: $C^3$ Perturbation Structure
items.content:
1207: :label: cor-smooth-perturbation
1208: 
1209: The adaptive force $\mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}(x_i, S) = \epsilon_F \nabla V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho](x_i)$ is a **$C^3$ perturbation** of the backbone system, with:
1210: 
1211: $$
1212: \|\nabla \mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}\| = \epsilon_F \|\nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}\| \le \epsilon_F H_{\max}(\rho)
1213: $$
1214: 
1215: $$
1216: \|\nabla^2 \mathbf{F}_{\text{adapt}}\| = \epsilon_F \|\nabla^3 V_{\text{fit}}\| \le \epsilon_F K_{V,3}(\rho)
1217: $$

items.label: cor-regularity-hierarchy
items.title: Regularity Hierarchy Complete
items.content:
1243: :label: cor-regularity-hierarchy
1244: 
1245: The fitness potential $V_{\text{fit}}[f_k, \rho]$ satisfies the complete regularity hierarchy:
1246: 
1247: $$
1248: V_{\text{fit}} \in C^1 \cap C^2 \cap C^3
1249: $$
1250: 
1251: with k-uniform and N-uniform bounds at each level:
1252: 
1253: | Regularity | Bound | Theorem |
1254: |------------|-------|---------|
1255: | Cp | $\|V_{\text{fit}}\| \le A$ | Axiom 3.2.1 |
1256: | $C^3$ | $\|\nabla V_{\text{fit}}\| \le F_{\text{adapt,max}}(\rho)$ | Theorem A.1 |
1257: | $C^3$ | $\|\nabla^2 V_{\text{fit}}\| \le H_{\max}(\rho)$ | Theorem A.2 |
1258: | $C^3$ | $\|\nabla^3 V_{\text{fit}}\| \le K_{V,3}(\rho)$ | Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-c3-regularity` |
